metadata.Title: CVE-2014-3506 on Ubuntu 14.04 LTS (trusty) - medium.
metadata.Description:
d1_both.c in the DTLS implementation in OpenSSL 0.9.8 before 0.9.8zb, 1.0.0 before 1.0.0n, and 1.0.1 before 1.0.1i allows remote attackers to cause a denial of service (memory consumption) via crafted DTLS handshake messages that trigger memory allocations corresponding to large length values.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2014-3506` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

libssl1.0.0 - 1.0.1f-1ubuntu2.5
openssl - 1.0.1f-1ubuntu2.5
No subscription required

criterions.comment: openssl package in trusty was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '1.0.1f-1ubuntu2.5').
openssl098: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support').
